chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Demiris Martez Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $5.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.  Bail to apply if applicable.  Payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL APPLICABLE COSTS/SURCHARGES:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or o ther means.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment and/or school, and/or vocational training.

No drugs or alcohol.
Do not frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
No drug paraphernalia.
No contact with known drug dealers.
No contact with the victim S.M.S. or family without prior Court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
No unsupervised contact with children 17 years of age and under without DOC chaperon or agent.
No firearms, weapons.

Sex offender assessment.  Follow through with recommended programming.
Successfully complete anger management and continue programming.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Cognitive intervention programming.
Dialectic Behavioral Therapy.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant  that because he was convicted of a violent felony, under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within five (5) years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year Initial Confinement.
No firearms, weapons.
---Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demiris Martez Bryant in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Demiris Martez Bryant in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  
Statements made as to sentencing. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS, with credit for 398 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Successfully complete  Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Dialectic Behavioral Therapy.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* No drug paraphenelia
* No contact with known drug dealers.
* No contact with the victim: SMS or family without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* No unsupervised contact with children 17 years of age and under without DOC chaperon or agent
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Restitution payable to Crime Victim Compensation fund for $5.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Demiris Martez Bryant in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Demiris Martez Bryant in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Amended information, received and filed, amending COUNT 1 to 1st DEGREE CHILD SEXUAL ASSAULT - SEXUAL CONTACT WITH A CHILD UNDER AGE 13, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(1)(e), a Class B felony.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demiris Martez Bryant in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Demiris Martez Bryant in custody.  Jesica Ballenger and Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

DAUBERT MOTION hearing proceeded:  Sworn for defendant:  David Thompson.  Cross examination.   Without hearing arguments from either party, Court finds Dr. Thompson should testify, and DENIES State's motion.  Reasons are placed on the record.  Case is adjourned for Jury Trial on 3/7/2016 at 10:00pm in br. 6.
